private_information: I can move disks A B C D E only
I cannot move disks F G H I J
I must follow Tower of Hanoi rules: only move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Cooperate to reach the goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A B D E F G H I J, middle peg top-to-bottom C, right peg empty, by producing an ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I can move

private_information: I can move disks F G H I J only
I cannot move disks A B C D E
I must follow Tower of Hanoi rules: only move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Cooperate to reach the goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A B D E F G H I J, middle peg top-to-bottom C, right peg empty, by producing an ordered list of primitive moves for the disks I can move

private_information: I coordinate and integrate move fragments produced by agent_1 and agent_2
I will produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownward solver that represents the whole multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' move fragments and produce a single correct PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encodes the cooperative Tower of Hanoi instance and is usable by FastDownward

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi instance with 10 disks labeled A smallest through J largest
Initial state: left peg has disks top-to-bottom A B C D E F G H I J, middle and right pegs are empty
Goal state: left peg must have top-to-bottom A B D E F G H I J, middle peg must have top-to-bottom C, right peg must be empty
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
Agents are restricted by which disk labels they may move: agent_1 may move A B C D E and agent_2 may move F G H I J
Moves must be expressed as primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from pegP to pegQ' where peg names are left, middle, right

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and you are specialized in moving the small disks A B C D E. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only the disks you may move. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and do not command disks you are not allowed to move. Each move must be in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Provide only the sequence of moves that involve your disks and that are necessary for reaching the global goal when combined with agent_2 moves.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_1->private_information} and the global goal {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in a single sequence. Only include moves you are permitted to perform. Do not emit PDDL.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and you are specialized in moving the large disks F G H I J. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only the disks you may move. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and do not command disks you are not allowed to move. Each move must be in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Provide only the sequence of moves that involve your disks and that are necessary for reaching the global goal when combined with agent_1 moves.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_2->private_information} and the global goal {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in a single sequence. Only include moves you are permitted to perform. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert multi-agent PDDL engineer and the orchestrator for this cooperative Tower of Hanoi instance. Your task is to integrate the move fragments provided by the agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the full multi-agent planning instance. Target the FastDownward solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct in the PDDL and include predicates or action signatures that reflect which agent can move which disks. Ensure the PDDL is syntactically valid for FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the public information {environment->public_information}, the agents' private information {agents->agent_1->private_information} and {agents->agent_2->private_information}, and the move fragments from the agents: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Integrate these fragments into a single correct PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that, when solved by FastDownward, yields a plan achieving the goal configuration. The PDDL must model three pegs left middle right, disks A through J with size ordering, the Tower of Hanoi legality constraints, and agent-specific movability constraints. Keep actions associated to agent_1 and agent_2 distinct. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
